data.enText: confident
thinking about what is good in a situation; feeling confident and sure that sth good will happen
a positive attitude/outlook
the power of positive thought

data.chText: 她力求对新工作更有信心。
data.enText: She tried to be more positive about her new job.

data.chText: 从好的方面看，利润增加了。
data.enText: On the positive side , profits have increased.

data.chText: 报告的结尾显得很乐观。
data.enText: The report ended on a positive note.
effective/useful

data.chText: 积极的；建设性的；朝着成功的
data.enText: directed at dealing with sth or producing a successful result

data.chText: 我们必须采取积极步骤处理这个问题。
data.enText: We must take positive steps to deal with the problem.

data.chText: 这将需要业内全体同人和衷共济。
data.enText: It will require positive action by all in the industry.
expressing agreement or support

data.chText: 我们对这个想法反应很好。
data.enText: We've had a very positive response to the idea.

data.chText: 良好的；有助益的；正面的
data.enText: good or useful
to make a positive contribution to a discussion

data.chText: 他的家庭对他有十分良好的影响。
data.enText: His family have been a very positive influence on him.

data.chText: 海外投资对出口有积极影响。
data.enText: Overseas investment has had a positive effect on exports.
sure/definite
completely sure that sth is correct or true

data.chText: 我说不准这事是什么时间发生的。
data.enText: I can't be positive about what time it happened.
She was positive that he had been there.
‘Are you sure?’ ‘Positive.’
complete and definite
He has a positive genius for upsetting people.

data.chText: 我们能够生还，完全是个奇迹。
data.enText: It was a positive miracle that we survived.
giving clear and definite proof or information

data.chText: 我们没有确凿证据证明她参与其事。
data.enText: We have no positive evidence that she was involved.

data.chText: 这就是他偷钱的肯定证据。
data.enText: This is proof positive that he stole the money.
scientific test
showing clear evidence that a particular substance or medical condition is present

data.chText: 呈阳性反应的怀孕检测
data.enText: a positive pregnancy test

data.chText: 这个运动员类固醇检测呈阳性。
data.enText: The athlete tested positive for steroids.

data.chText: 艾滋病病毒化验呈阳性
data.enText: to be HIV positive
number/quantity
greater than zero
electricity
containing or producing the type of electricity that is carried by a proton
a positive charge
the positive terminal of a battery
good quality
a good or useful quality or aspect

data.chText: 把你自己的弱点变成优点。
data.enText: Take your weaknesses and translate them into positives.
in photography
a developed film showing light and dark areas and colours as they actually were, especially one printed from a negative
result of test
the result of a test or an experiment that shows that a substance or condition is present

data.chText: 以上各词均指确信、肯定、有把握。
data.enText: These words all describe sb who knows without doubt that sth is true or will happen.
sure

data.chText: 指确信、肯定、有把握、必定：
data.enText: [not before noun] without any doubt that you are right, that sth is true, that you will get sth or that sth will happen

data.chText: “那边那个人是约翰吗？”“我说不准。”
data.enText: ‘Is that John over there?’ ‘I'm not sure.’
Are you sure about that?

data.chText: 英格兰队必须拿下这场比赛才能确保获得资格。
data.enText: England must win this game to be sure of qualifying.

data.chText: sure常用于否定句和疑问句，表示有所怀疑或担忧。毫无疑问时常用quite sure：
data.enText: Sure is often used in negative statements and questions, because there is some doubt or anxiety over the matter. If there is no doubt, people often say quite sure .

data.chText: 我肯定是把包丢在这儿了。
data.enText: I'm quite sure (that) I left my bag here (= I have no doubt about it) .
confident
completely sure that sth will happen in the way that you want or expect

data.chText: 我肯定你能得到那份工作。
data.enText: I'm quite confident that you'll get the job.

data.chText: 这个队觉得有把握取胜。
data.enText: The team feels confident of winning.

data.chText: confident较sure语气强，而且更肯定，在无所担忧的情况下较常用于肯定句中。
data.enText: Confident is a stronger and more definite word than sure and is more often used in positive statements, when you feel no anxiety.
convinced

data.chText: 指坚信、深信、确信，尤指有证据证明或经说服：
data.enText: [not before noun] completely sure that sth is true or right, especially because the evidence seems to prove it or sb else has persuaded you to believe it

data.chText: 我坚信她是清白无辜的。
data.enText: I'm convinced that she's innocent.
certain
[not usually before noun] sure that you are right or that sth is true

data.chText: 你对这事绝对确信无疑吗？
data.enText: Are you absolutely certain about this?

data.chText: certain与sure一样，常用于否定句和疑问句中，但比sure稍正式些。sure较常用，尤其是在英语口语中。
data.enText: Like sure , certain is often used in negative statements and questions. It is slightly more formal than sure ; sure is more frequent, especially in spoken English.
sure or certain?
positive

data.chText: 指有绝对把握、确信、肯定：
data.enText: [not before noun] ( rather informal ) completely sure that sth is true
She was positive that he'd been there.
‘Are you sure?’ ‘Positive.’
sure/confident/convinced/certain/positive about sth
sure/confident/convinced/certain of sth
sure/confident/convinced/certain/positive that…
sure/certain who/what/how , etc.
to be/feel/seem/sound sure/confident/convinced/certain/positive
quite/absolutely/completely/fairly/pretty sure/confident/convinced/certain/positive
not altogether sure/confident/convinced/certain
(not) very sure/confident

simple_means.memory_skill: posit 放，放置 + ive …的 → 放在那 → 肯定的

ex.chText: 他绝对肯定他以前见过她。
ex.enText: He is absolutely certain/positive that he has met her before.

ex.chText: 她不确定电影何时开始。
ex.enText: She's not certain/positive when the movie will begin.

ex.chText: 毋庸置疑，有果必有因。
ex.enText: It is certain/positive that every effect must have a cause.

ex.chText: 他确信水果熟了。
ex.enText: He is certain/positive that the fruit is ripe.

synonyms.bx: 指确定无疑的，表示说话人有确切的理由或不容置疑的证据，语气较强，通常作表语，多用于肯定句或正式的书面语中，常可与positive 换用，但不可单独用作回答。

ex.chText: 他们确信明年的利润会增加。
ex.enText: They are confident next year's profits will be higher.

ex.chText: 法国足球队对取胜很有把握。
ex.enText: The French football team is confident of victory.

ex.chText: 委员会对成功很有把握。
ex.enText: The committee is confident of success.

synonyms.bx: 指确信某事会以自己想要或期望的方式发生的，通常作表语。

ex.chText: 我确信我们做的事情是正确的。
ex.enText: I am convinced that we are doing the right thing.

ex.chText: 我完全确信我们能做这件事。
ex.enText: I am fully convinced we can do it.

ex.chText: 他坚信在其他行星上可能存在生命。
ex.enText: He is firmly convinced of the possibility of life on other planets.

synonyms.bx: 指对某事深信不疑的，通常作表语，常后接介词 of 或 that 从句。

ex.chText: 她绝对肯定她开窗户了。
ex.enText: She is absolutely positive that she opened the window.

ex.chText: 他说不准是在哪里丢的钥匙。
ex.enText: He can't be positive where he lost his key.

ex.chText: —-那事你能肯定吗？
ex.enText: -Are you sure about that?
-Positive.

ex.chText: 我们会从这笔交易中赚到钱的，对此我有把握。
ex.enText: We'll benefit from this deal -I'm positive of that.

synonyms.bx: 指对某事物的正确性或真实性绝对肯定的，通常作表语，可单独用作肯定回答，常后接介词 about/of 或 that 从句。

ex.chText: 我肯定他是诚实的。
ex.enText: I am sure/certain that he is honest.

ex.chText: 你肯定这条路对吗?
ex.enText: Are you sure/certain that this is the right road?

ex.chText: 他不能肯定他是否能如期回来。
ex.enText: He wasn't sure/certain whether he would be able to get back as planned.

synonyms.bx: 指主观上对某事物的正确性或真实性没有疑虑的，常可与 certain 换用，但语气稍弱，通常作表语。

ex.chText: 该植物在适宜的条件下会结出果子。
ex.enText: This plant will produce fruits under favourable conditions.

ex.chText: 细菌在适当的条件下繁殖很快。
ex.enText: Bacteria multiply quickly under favourable conditions.

ex.chText: 在有利于海外投资的国际环境下，这个公司获得了巨额的利润。
ex.enText: The company has made a huge profit in an international environment that is favourable to overseas investment.

synonyms.bx: 指有利于某事发生或成功的。

ex.chText: 这份合同对业主有利。
ex.enText: This contract is advantageous to the owners.

ex.chText: 你的对手现在处于有利地位，所以你最好更谨慎一些。
ex.enText: You'd better be more cautious, as your rival is in an advantageous position.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人、某种情况等有好处或有帮助的。

ex.chText: 这些蔬菜对人们的健康有好处。
ex.enText: These vegetables have a positive effect on people's health.

ex.chText: 海外留学对他来说是一种有益的经历。
ex.enText: Studying overseas has been a positive experience for him.

synonyms.bx: 指积极的、良好的或有所助益的。

tr: a film showing a photographic image whose tones correspond to those of the original subject
the primary form of an adjective or adverb
denotes a quality without qualification, comparison, or relation to increase or diminution

example: so overconfident and impudent as to speak to the queen
the less he knows the more positive he gets
incontrovertible proof of the defendant's innocence

tr: characterized by or displaying affirmation or acceptance or certainty etc.
reckoned, situated or tending in the direction which naturally or arbitrarily is taken to indicate increase or progress or onward motion
indicating existence or presence of a suspected condition or pathogen

value.def: If you are positive about things, you are hopeful and confident, and think of the good aspects of a situation rather than the bad ones.

example.ex: Be positive about your future and get on with living a normal life...
example.tran: 要对自己的未来充满信心，继续过一种正常的生活。

example.ex: Her husband became much more positive and was soon back in full-time employment.
example.tran: 她丈夫自信大增，不久便重新开始全职工作。

example.ex: ...a positive frame of mind.
example.tran: 积极的心态

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ <l>about</l> n

value.tran: 抱有希望的；有信心的；积极的

example.ex: You really must try to start thinking positively.
example.tran: 你真的必须努力开始以一种积极的心态思考问题了。

value.def: A positive fact, situation, or experience is pleasant and helpful to you in some way.

example.ex: The parting from his sister had a positive effect on John...
example.tran: 和姐姐分开对约翰来说有好处。

example.ex: Working abroad should be an exciting and positive experience for all concerned.
example.tran: 在海外工作对所有相关人员来说都应该是一段让人兴奋而愉快的经历。

posc.def: The positive in a situation is the good and pleasant aspects of it.

example.ex: Work on the positive, creating beautiful, loving and fulfilling relationships.
example.tran: 致力于好的方面，努力营造美好的、友爱的、令人满意的关系。

value.def: If you make a positive decision or take positive action, you do something definite in order to deal with a task or problem.

example.ex: There are positive changes that should be implemented in the rearing of animals...
example.tran: 应该对动物饲养进行明确的改革。

example.ex: He was expected to make a very positive contribution to the 1996 Games organisation...
example.tran: 人们期待他为1996年奥运会的组织做出积极的贡献。

example.ex: Having a good diet gives me a sense that I'm doing something positive and that I'm in control.
example.tran: 合理膳食让我感觉自己并非无所作为且能安排好自己的生活。

value.def: A positive response to something indicates agreement, approval, or encouragement.

example.ex: There's been a positive response to the UN Secretary-General's recent peace efforts.
example.tran: 联合国秘书长近期为和平所作出的努力得到了积极的回应。

example.ex: He responded positively and accepted the fee of £1,000 I had offered.
example.tran: 他作出了肯定的答复，并接受了我给的1，000英镑的费用。

value.def: If you are positive about something, you are completely sure about it.

example.ex: I'm as positive as I can be about it...
example.tran: 我对它有绝对的把握。

example.ex: 'She's never late. You sure she said eight?' — 'Positive.'
example.tran: “她从不迟到，你肯定她说的是8点？”——“肯定。”

value.def: Positive evidence gives definite proof of the truth or identity of something.

example.ex: There was no positive evidence that any birth defects had arisen as a result of Vitamin A intake.
example.tran: 没有确凿证据证明，摄取维生素A会导致出生缺陷。

example.ex: He has positively identified the body as that of his wife.
example.tran: 他已确认那是他妻子的尸体。

value.def: If a medical or scientific test is positive, it shows that something has happened or is present.

example.ex: If the test is positive, a course of antibiotics may be prescribed...
example.tran: 如果化验结果呈阳性，可能会开一个疗程的抗生素。

example.ex: He was stripped of his Olympic Hundred Metres gold medal after testing positive for steroids.
example.tran: 类固醇检测呈阳性后，他的奥运百米金牌被收回。

value.def: You can use positive to emphasize a noun.

example.ex: Good day to you, Bernard! It's a positive delight to see you...
example.tran: 你好，伯纳德！见到你真高兴。

example.ex: He was in a positive fury...
example.tran: 他确实发怒了。

example.ex: The man was being a positive embarrassment.
example.tran: 这位男士极为尴尬。

value.tran: （强调名词）完完全全的，千真万确的，实实在在的

value.def: A positive number is greater than zero.

example.ex: It's really a simple numbers game with negative and positive numbers.
example.tran: 它其实就是正负数的简单数字游戏。

value.def: If something has a positive electrical charge, it has the same charge as a proton and the opposite charge to an electron.

example.ex: ...positively charged ions.
example.tran: 阳离子

trans: 积极的影响；正面影响；积极作用；积极效果；正向效应
正反；正负；正反面；身份证正反面；正面与负面
变化趋势相同的两个变量的关系（正相关）
积极的影响；正面影响；正面影响力；正面的影响
积极变化；积极改变；积极的改变；正向的改变
积极行动；积极的行为；积极作为；积极的措施；积极行动方案

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to put, to place 放, 放置
rootsaffixes.title: pon, pound, pos(it)

partsOfSpeech.dec: ap 加强 + posit 放，放置 + e → 放到〔合适的位置〕→ 适当的
ap 表加强 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 放在〔一起〕→ 并置
com 共同 + pon 放，放置 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 共同放到一起 → 组成的
com 共同 + pos 放，放置 + e → 放到一起 → 组成
com 共同 + posit 放，放置 + e → 放到一起 → 合成物
com 共同 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 放到一起 → 组合 → 组合文字 → 作文
com 共同 + pos 放，放置 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 共同放置〔危险品〕→ 沉着
com 共同 + pound 放，放置 → 都放到一起 → 化合物
de 向下 + pos 放，放置 + e → 下放；下沉 → 免职；沉淀
de 向下 + posit 放，放置 → 放下不用 → 储存
deposit 储存 + ary 场所 → 储藏室
dis 不 + compose 组成 → 使不安
dis 分开 + pos 放，放置 + e → 分开〔排好〕→ 排列
dis 分散 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 分开放 → 安排
ex 出 + pon 放，放置 + ent 表人 → 把〔内容〕讲出来 → 讲解者
ex 出 + pos 放，放置 + e → 放出来 → 暴露
ex 出 + posit 放，放置 + ion，expose 的名词 → 展览；解释
ex 出 + pound 放，放置 → 把〔意义〕说出来 → 详细说明
im 使… + pos 放，放置 + e → 强行放置 → 强加
im 使… + posit 放，放置 + ion，impose 的名词 → 征税；强加
im 进入 + pound 放，放置 → 放进去 → 把…围住；扣押
op 反 + pon 放，放置 + ent 具有…性质的 → 反着放 → 对立的
op 反 + posit 放，放置 + e → 放在对面 → 相对的
posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 放出的〔立场〕
posit 放，放置 + ive …的 → 放在那 → 肯定的
post 后 + pon 放，放置 + e → 向后放 → 推迟
pro 向前 + pon 放，放置 + e →〔把意见〕往前放 → 提议
propon〔e〕提议，提出 + ent 表人 → 提议者
pro 前 + pos 放，放置 + al 表行为 → 向前放 → 提议
pro 向前 + pound 放，放置 → 向前放 → 提出
pur 始终 + pos 放，放置 + e → 始终放不下的东西 → 目的
re 一再 + pos 放，放置 + e → 一再放下〔工作〕→ 休息
re 加强 + posit 放，放置 + ory 表地点 → 放东西之地 → 仓库
sup 下 + pos 放，放置 + e → 在下面提出 → 推测
sup 下 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 推测
trans 转移 + pose 位置 →〔互相〕移放 → 互换位置
